intro: Lapsana rhagadiolus, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Lapsana rhagadiolus is typically perennial, though it may behave as an annual in some regions.
